subject: Re: [junit] @BeforeClass throws NullPointerException
msgSnippet: ... Which is exactly why the @BeforeClass annotation needs to go on static methods. JUnit 4 still has an instance per test, not one shared instance of each
messageBody:
On 9/30/05, Alexandru Popescu <the.mindstorm.mailinglist@...> wrote:
> I just realised that in fact for JUnit is impossible to work that way by default:
>
> for each test method a new instance is created => @BeforeClass would be invoked for each test method
> => it is loosing its goal.

Which is exactly why the @BeforeClass annotation needs to go on static methods.

JUnit 4 still has an instance per test, not one shared instance of
each class per test. Each annotation is a test. This is also backed by
the experience of the NUnit developers, who have admitted that their
decision to use one instance of each class containing tests was
probably a mistake.

Yes, having an instance of each class per test is different than
TestNG. That doesn't make it wrong (nor does it make TestNG wrong).
They both have strengths and weaknesses (with TestNG's being the lack
of enforced isolation between tests)

Robert.
